title: 'We needed someone like him': Leonardo Bonucci hails Antonio Conte for his work at Juventus
text:
Leonardo Bonucci has praised Antonio Conte for the work that he did at Juventus, saying that he was the perfect manager for the club at the time.

Now in charge of Inter Milan, Conte managed Juventus from 2011 to 2014, and won the Serie A title in each of his three seasons at the club.

Conte's Inter host Juventus on Sunday, and Bonucci hailed Conte for the excellent work that he did at Juventus in terms of instilling a winning mentality at the club.

Leonardo Bonucci has praised Antonio Conte for the work that he did while at Juventus

Bonucci credited Conte with helping to instil a winning mentality at Juventus

'What Conte gave me was hunger, the desire to never give in, the mentality that allows you to go beyond pain to reach your objectives,' Bonucci told Sky Sport Italia (via Football Italia).

'He drilled that into us from the first day. Conte was perfect for that Juventus: he needed a chance with a big club and we had to get back to being great after Calciopoli. We needed someone like him, who could make us understand what it meant to wear that jersey.

'After three top years together, our paths separated and we continued the growth process elsewhere, but maintained a relationship.'

Conte, who won three Serie A titles with Juventus, is now set to face his old club with Inter

Inter are currently top of Serie A having won all six of their league games under Conte so far, and are two points ahead of Juventus.

Bonucci spoke in glowing terms about Inter, emphasising the difficult task that Inter face.

Bonucci said: 'Inter started the season very well, which was indeed easy to foresee after the arrival of Conte. They're a great team, they have top players and their system allows everyone to express themselves in the best way.'

After initially playing for Juventus between 2010 and 2017, Bonucci rejoined the club in 2018. In total he has won seven Serie A titles with the club and three Coppa Italias.
